content: üìä Affordable European Countries vs. Education Quality: The Best Bang for Your Buck
title: Affordable Europe

content: üéì Introduction Hello #DataFam! I‚Äôm thrilled to share my first-ever personal data visualization project created during my data visualization course at the University of North Texas! In this project, I analyzed a dataset that explores education expenses across European countries, focusing on how affordability correlates with education quality.
title: Affordable Europe

content: üîç Research Questions Which countries provide the most budget-friendly education options, considering tuition and living costs? What is the average tuition fee across these countries? How does the cost compare to the quality of education provided?
title: Affordable Europe

content: üí° Key Insights ‚úÖ Cost & Living Expenses Matter: When considering affordable education in Europe, both tuition fees and living costs must be considered together. ‚úÖ Most Affordable Countries: Germany leads with the lowest tuition. Followed by Portugal, Spain, Lithuania, Austria, Greece, and Italy. Bulgaria offers the most affordable education overall (low tuition + low cost of living). ‚úÖ Most Expensive Countries: The Netherlands, Denmark, Finland, Sweden, and the UK have the highest tuition fees. Ireland, Denmark, and Finland also have high living costs. ‚úÖ Average Tuition: Across the countries analyzed, the average tuition fee is around ¬£4,000. ‚úÖ Cost ‚â† Quality: Affordability doesn‚Äôt always guarantee high education quality. Estonia ranked #1 for education quality and access (Score: 91.86) based on a study using 17 intelligence and development indicators. Other top-ranked countries include: Switzerland (84.92) Ireland (84.78) UK (81.90) Finland, Germany, Denmark, Sweden, Belgium, and Slovenia also scored well.
title: Affordable Europe

content: üß† The Bottom Line üí∞ Best Value: Germany and Finland offer an ideal balance‚Äîsolid education without breaking the bank. ‚öñÔ∏è The Trade-Off: Affordable doesn‚Äôt always mean low quality, and expensive doesn‚Äôt always mean elite. üìö Hidden Gems: Several countries provide high-quality education at a lower cost, if you know where to look.
title: Affordable Europe

content: üõ†Ô∏è Behind the Scenes This project was developed using Tableau, where I merged two different datasets: One covering tuition fees and living costs. Another ranking education quality based on intelligence, accessibility, and development metrics. This exercise helped me explore data storytelling, and how visual insights can bring clarity to complex trade-offs like cost vs. quality in education. üîó View the full Tableau visualization here
title: Affordable Europe

content: üëã Final Thoughts I‚Äôm still learning, but this project helped me grow my skills in: Data analysis & storytelling Multi-dataset merging Visualization design Insight communication If you‚Äôre passionate about data-driven storytelling, I‚Äôd love your feedback, and would be thrilled to connect and exchange ideas. Thank you for reading!
title: Affordable Europe
